title: AAQ: Does Modern Science Believe in Reincarnation  |  His Grace Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa
speaker: HG Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa

segments.key_quote: It's not that if you are a believer in science, you cannot be a believer in God. It's not like that. Because both are different branches of knowledge.
segments.summary: The speaker addresses the question of whether modern science accepts reincarnation, stating that opinions vary among scientists and that belief in science doesn't preclude belief in God, as they are different fields of knowledge.
segments.transcript: I believe in reincarnation. Does modern science accept it or not? Modern science, well, it ranges from 0 to 100. There are people in science who don't believe in reincarnation. There are people who believe somewhere in between. There are people who believe totally in reincarnation. So we have all kinds of people. It's not that if you are a believer in science, you cannot be a believer in God. It's not like that, because both are different branches of knowledge. It's like asking, does someone who believes in physics really believe in mathematics? Or someone who believes in mathematics really believe in biology? Both are different branches of knowledge, so you cannot compare both of them. But yes, there are people who believe in God. There are people who believe in science who don't believe in reincarnation, don't believe in the existence of soul, etc. And there are many scientists, Nobel laureates, those who have achieved a lot in the field of chemistry, science, physics, etc. There are many people like that who believe that there must be a higher being behind this creation. There must be a higher intelligence behind this creation.

segments.summary: The speaker criticizes scientists who are blinded by the allure of material advancements, preventing them from seeing the simple truth of reincarnation and the limitations of material explanations for life.
